registers.name: tag
registers.description: [0x000-0x003] Tag, fixed value 0x42464346UL

registers.name: reserved0
registers.description: [0x008-0x00b] Reserved for future use

registers.name: readSampleClkSrc
registers.description: [0x00c-0x00c] Read Sample Clock Source, valid value: 0/1/3

registers.name: csHoldTime
registers.description: [0x00d-0x00d] CS hold time, default value: 3

registers.name: csSetupTime
registers.description: [0x00e-0x00e] CS setup time, default value: 3

registers.name: columnAddressWidth
registers.description: [0x00f-0x00f] Column Address with, for HyperBus protocol, it is fixed to 3, For  Serial NAND, need to refer to datasheet

registers.name: deviceModeCfgEnable
registers.description: [0x010-0x010] Device Mode Configure enable flag, 1 - Enable, 0 - Disable

registers.name: deviceModeType
registers.description: [0x011-0x011] Specify the configuration command type:Quad Enable, DPI/QPI/OPI switch,  Generic configuration, etc.

registers.name: waitTimeCfgCommands
registers.description: [0x012-0x013] Wait time for all configuration commands, unit: 100us, Used for  DPI/QPI/OPI switch or reset command

registers.name: deviceModeSeq
registers.description: [0x014-0x017] Device mode sequence info, [7:0] - LUT sequence id, [15:8] - LUt  sequence number, [31:16] Reserved

bitfields.name: seqNum
bitfields.description: Sequence Number, valid number: 1-16

bitfields.name: seqId
bitfields.description: Sequence Index, valid number: 0-15

bitfields.name: reserved
bitfields.description: N/A

registers.name: deviceModeArg
registers.description: [0x018-0x01b] Argument/Parameter for device configuration

registers.name: configCmdEnable
registers.description: [0x01c-0x01c] Configure command Enable Flag, 1 - Enable, 0 - Disable

registers.name: configModeType_0
registers.description: [0x01d-0x01f] Configure Mode Type, similar as deviceModeTpe

registers.name: configModeType_1
registers.description: [0x01d-0x01f] Configure Mode Type, similar as deviceModeTpe

registers.name: configModeType_2
registers.description: [0x01d-0x01f] Configure Mode Type, similar as deviceModeTpe

registers.name: configCmdSeqs_0
registers.description: [0x020-0x02b] Sequence info for Device Configuration command, similar as deviceModeSeq

bitfields.name: seqNum
bitfields.description: Sequence Number, valid number: 1-16

bitfields.name: seqId
bitfields.description: Sequence Index, valid number: 0-15

bitfields.name: reserved
bitfields.description: N/A

registers.name: configCmdSeqs_1
registers.description: [0x020-0x02b] Sequence info for Device Configuration command, similar as deviceModeSeq

bitfields.name: seqNum
bitfields.description: Sequence Number, valid number: 1-16

bitfields.name: seqId
bitfields.description: Sequence Index, valid number: 0-15

bitfields.name: reserved
bitfields.description: N/A

registers.name: configCmdSeqs_2
registers.description: [0x020-0x02b] Sequence info for Device Configuration command, similar as deviceModeSeq

bitfields.name: seqNum
bitfields.description: Sequence Number, valid number: 1-16

bitfields.name: seqId
bitfields.description: Sequence Index, valid number: 0-15

bitfields.name: reserved
bitfields.description: N/A

registers.name: reserved1
registers.description: [0x02c-0x02f] Reserved for future use

registers.name: configCmdArgs_0
registers.description: [0x030-0x03b] Arguments/Parameters for device Configuration commands

registers.name: configCmdArgs_1
registers.description: [0x030-0x03b] Arguments/Parameters for device Configuration commands

registers.name: configCmdArgs_2
registers.description: [0x030-0x03b] Arguments/Parameters for device Configuration commands

registers.name: reserved2
registers.description: [0x03c-0x03f] Reserved for future use

registers.name: controllerMiscOption
registers.description: [0x040-0x043] Controller Misc Options, see Misc feature bit definitions for more  details

registers.name: deviceType
registers.description: [0x044-0x044] Device Type:  See Flash Type Definition for more details

registers.name: sflashPadType
registers.description: [0x045-0x045] Serial Flash Pad Type: 1 - Single, 2 - Dual, 4 - Quad, 8 - Octal

registers.name: serialClkFreq
registers.description: [0x046-0x046] Serial Flash Frequency, device specific definitions, See System Boot  Chapter for more details

registers.name: lutCustomSeqEnable
registers.description: [0x047-0x047] LUT customization Enable, it is required if the program/erase cannot  be done using 1 LUT sequence, currently, only applicable to HyperFLASH

registers.name: reserved3_0
registers.description: [0x048-0x04f] Reserved for future use

registers.name: reserved3_1
registers.description: [0x048-0x04f] Reserved for future use

registers.name: sflashA1Size
registers.description: [0x050-0x053] Size of Flash connected to A1

registers.name: sflashA2Size
registers.description: [0x054-0x057] Size of Flash connected to A2

registers.name: sflashB1Size
registers.description: [0x058-0x05b] Size of Flash connected to B1

registers.name: sflashB2Size
registers.description: [0x05c-0x05f] Size of Flash connected to B2

registers.name: csPadSettingOverride
registers.description: [0x060-0x063] CS pad setting override value

registers.name: sclkPadSettingOverride
registers.description: [0x064-0x067] SCK pad setting override value

registers.name: dataPadSettingOverride
registers.description: [0x068-0x06b] data pad setting override value

registers.name: dqsPadSettingOverride
registers.description: [0x06c-0x06f] DQS pad setting override value

registers.name: timeoutInMs
registers.description: [0x070-0x073] Timeout threshold for read status command

registers.name: commandInterval
registers.description: [0x074-0x077] CS deselect interval between two commands

registers.name: dataValidTime_0
registers.description: [0x078-0x07b] CLK edge to data valid time for PORT A and PORT B

registers.name: dataValidTime_1
registers.description: [0x078-0x07b] CLK edge to data valid time for PORT A and PORT B

registers.name: busyOffset
registers.description: [0x07c-0x07d] Busy offset, valid value: 0-31

registers.name: busyBitPolarity
registers.description: [0x07e-0x07f] Busy flag polarity, 0 - busy flag is 1 when flash device is busy, 1 -  busy flag is 0 when flash device is busy

registers.name: lookupTable_seq0_instr0
registers.description: Lookup table holds Flash command sequences 0, instruction 0

bitfields.name: OPERAND
bitfields.description: Instruction operand. Its values depends on used instruction

bitfields.name: NUM_PADS
bitfields.description: Number of pads used by instruction. Some instructions ignores this parameter.

values.name: 1PAD
values.description: Single mode. One pad is used.

values.name: 2PAD
values.description: Dual mode. Two pads are used.

values.name: 4PAD
values.description: Quad mode. Four pads are used.

values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.

values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_DDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_DDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_DDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_DDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_DDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: 8PAD
values.description: Octal mode. Eight pads are used.

bitfields.name: OPERATION_CODE
bitfields.description: Instruction operation code.

values.name: STOP
values.description: Stop execution and de-assert CS. Then, the next command sequence (to the same flash device) starts from instruction pointer 0.

values.name: CMD_SDR
values.description: Transmit command code to Flash.

values.name: RADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit row address to Flash.

values.name: CADDR_SDR
values.description: Transmit column address to Flash.

values.name: MODE1_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE2_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE4_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: MODE8_SDR
values.description: Transmit mode bits to Flash.

values.name: WRITE_SDR
values.description: Transmit program data to Flash device.

values.name: READ_SDR
values.description: Receive read data from Flash device. Read data is put into AHB_RX_BUF or IP_RX_FIFO.

values.name: LEARN_SDR
values.description: Receive read data or Preamble bit from Flash deviceThe FlexSPI controller will compare the data line bits with DLPR register to determine a correct sampling clock phase.

values.name: DATSZ_SDR
values.description: Transmit read or program data size (byte number) to Flash device.

values.name: DUMMY_SDR
values.description: Leave data lines undriven by the FlexSPI controller. Turnaround cycles are provided from host driving to device driving. num_pads determines the number of pads in input mode.

values.name: DUMMY_RWDS_SDR
values.description: This instruction is similar to DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_DDR instruction. The difference lies in the dummy cycle number.DQS pin is called RWDS in HyperBus specification. See Dummy instruction for more details.Set operand as 'Latency count' for HyperBus devices.

values.name: JMP_ON_CS
values.description: Stop execution, de-assert CS and save operand[7:0] as the instruction start pointer for next sequence.Normally this instruction is used to support Execute-In-Place enhanced mode. See XIP enhanced mode for more details.This instruction is only allowed for AHB read commands. There is interrupt status bit set (INTR[IPCMDERR] or INTR[AHBCMDERR]) when using this instruction in IP command or AHB write command.
